[h1]File Info[/h1]

Ruby provides some useful methods to get relevant information about a file.
The [b]size [/b]method returns the size of the file.
The [b]zero?[/b] method returns true if the named file exists and has a zero size (is empty).
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="rb" codeId="1096"]# create a file
f = File.new("test.txt", "w+")
f.puts("some file content")

puts f.[b]size[/b] # 19

f.close

puts File.[b]zero?[/b]("test.txt") # false[/code]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to open the file "demo.txt" and output its contents if it is readable.
[!raw!]
if {0}.{1}("demo.txt")
  File.{2}("demo.txt")
end
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]File Info[/h1]

We can also check whether the file is writable, readable or executable: [code format="rb" codeId="1097"]f = File.new("test.txt", "w+")
f.puts("some content")
f.close

puts File.[b]readable?[/b]("test.txt") # true
puts File.[b]writable?[/b]("test.txt")   # true
puts File.[b]executable?[/b]("test.txt") # false[/code]
